document.title: Effect of Polyprenyl Immunostimulant on the survival times of three cats with the dry form of feline infectious peritonitis.
document.abstract: Feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) is considered a fatal disease. Three cats with dry form FIP were treated with Polyprenyl Immunostimulant. Two of the three cats are still on treatment and are alive and well 2 years after diagnosis. The third cat survived 14 months but was treated for only 4.5 months. Further studies are necessary to assess the potential of the Polyprenyl Immunostimulant.
document.publication-title: Faculty Publications and Other Works -- Small Animal Clinical Sciences

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: A L. Legendre and Joe Bartges. "Effect of Polyprenyl Immunostimulant on the survival times of three cats with the dry form of feline infectious peritonitis." Journal of Feline Medicine and Surgery 11.8 (2009): 624-626.
